title: Augusta County: Jedediah Hotchkiss to John H. McCue, February 8, 1859
summary: Jedediah Hotchkiss regrets that he cannot visit John H. McCue, because Hotchkiss is in the midst of deciding to purchase the Addison Cochran farm, where he plans to open a women's seminary with his brother. He also asks if McCue has any news of an unsettled suit in which he is involved.
keywords: Agriculture, Church/Religious Activity, Economy, Family, Home Front, Women, American Civil War
